messages.accessibilityAltText: <{{element}}/> element must have a text alternative.

accessibility-alt-text.description: Enforces alternate text for elements which require the alt, aria-label, aria-labelledby attributes.

messages.noPositiveTabindex: The `tabindex` attribute should not be positive

no-positive-tabindex.description: Ensures that the `tabindex` attribute is not positive

messages.accessibilityValidAria: The `{{attribute}}` is an invalid ARIA attribute
messages.accessibilityValidAriaValue: The `{{attribute}}` has an invalid value. Check the valid values at https://raw.githack.com/w3c/aria/stable/#roles

accessibility-valid-aria.description: Ensures that correct ARIA attributes and respective values are used

messages.noDistractingElements: Do not use <{{element}}> elements as they can create visual accessibility issues and are deprecated

no-distracting-elements.description: Enforces that no distracting elements are used

messages.useTrackByFunction: Missing trackBy function in ngFor directive

messages.noNegatedAsync: Async pipe results should not be negated. Use `(observable | async) === false`, `(observable | async) === null`, or `(observable | async) === undefined` to check its value instead

no-negated-async.description: Ensures that async pipe results are not negated

banana-in-box.description: Ensures that the two-way data binding syntax is correct

eqeqeq.description: Requires `===` and `!==` in place of `==` and `!=`

curly.description: Enforce consistent brace style for all control statements

messages.max: This line has a length of {{lineLength}}. Maximum allowed is {{maxLength}}.
messages.maxComment: This line has a comment length of {{lineLength}}. Maximum allowed is {{maxCommentLength}}.

messages.confusing: Arrow function used ambiguously with a conditional expression.

no-confusing-arrow.description: Disallow arrow functions where they could be confused with comparisons

messages.unexpectedMixedOperator: Unexpected mix of '{{leftOperator}}' and '{{rightOperator}}'. Use parentheses to clarify the intended order of operations.

messages.function: Unexpected newline between function and ( of function call.
messages.property: Unexpected newline between object and [ of property access.
messages.taggedTemplate: Unexpected newline between template tag and template literal.
messages.division: Unexpected newline between numerator and division operator.

quotes.description: Enforce the consistent use of either backticks, double, or single quotes

messages.unexpectedOpeningLinebreak: There should be no linebreak after '['.
messages.unexpectedClosingLinebreak: There should be no linebreak before ']'.

array-bracket-newline.description: Enforce linebreaks after opening and before closing array brackets

messages.unexpectedSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '{{tokenValue}}'.
messages.unexpectedSpaceBefore: There should be no space before '{{tokenValue}}'.

array-bracket-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing inside array brackets

messages.unexpectedLineBreak: There should be no linebreak here.
messages.missingLineBreak: There should be a linebreak after this element.

array-element-newline.description: Enforce line breaks after each array element

messages.unexpectedParens: Unexpected parentheses around single function argument.
messages.expectedParens: Expected parentheses around arrow function argument.
messages.unexpectedParensInline: Unexpected parentheses around single function argument having a body with no curly braces.
messages.expectedParensBlock: Expected parentheses around arrow function argument having a body with curly braces.

arrow-parens.description: Require parentheses around arrow function arguments

arrow-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after the arrow in arrow functions

block-spacing.description: Disallow or enforce spaces inside of blocks after opening block and before closing block

messages.nextLineOpen: Opening curly brace does not appear on the same line as controlling statement.
messages.sameLineOpen: Opening curly brace appears on the same line as controlling statement.
messages.blockSameLine: Statement inside of curly braces should be on next line.
messages.nextLineClose: Closing curly brace does not appear on the same line as the subsequent block.
messages.singleLineClose: Closing curly brace should be on the same line as opening curly brace or on the line after the previous block.
messages.sameLineClose: Closing curly brace appears on the same line as the subsequent block.

brace-style.description: Enforce consistent brace style for blocks

comma-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after commas

messages.unexpectedLineBeforeAndAfterComma: Bad line breaking before and after ','.

messages.unexpectedSpaceBefore: There should be no space before '{{tokenValue}}'.
messages.unexpectedSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '{{tokenValue}}'.

computed-property-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing inside computed property brackets

messages.expectedDotAfterObject: Expected dot to be on same line as object.
messages.expectedDotBeforeProperty: Expected dot to be on same line as property.

dot-location.description: Enforce consistent newlines before and after dots

messages.missing: Newline required at end of file but not found.
messages.unexpected: Newline not allowed at end of file.

eol-last.description: Require or disallow newline at the end of files

messages.unexpectedWhitespace: Unexpected whitespace between function name and paren.
messages.unexpectedNewline: Unexpected newline between function name and paren.
messages.missing: Missing space between function name and paren.

func-call-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing between function identifiers and their invocations

messages.unexpectedLineBreak: There should be no line break here.
messages.missingLineBreak: There should be a line break after this argument.

function-call-argument-newline.description: Enforce line breaks between arguments of a function call

function-paren-newline.description: Enforce consistent line breaks inside function parentheses

generator-star-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing around `*` operators in generator functions

messages.expected: Expected a linebreak before this expression.
messages.unexpected: Expected no linebreak before this expression.

implicit-arrow-linebreak.description: Enforce the location of arrow function bodies

jsx-quotes.description: Enforce the consistent use of either double or single quotes in JSX attributes

key-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing between keys and values in object literal properties

keyword-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after keywords

messages.expectedLF: Expected linebreaks to be 'LF' but found 'CRLF'.
messages.expectedCRLF: Expected linebreaks to be 'CRLF' but found 'LF'.

messages.expectedTestCons: Expected newline between test and consequent of ternary expression.
messages.expectedConsAlt: Expected newline between consequent and alternate of ternary expression.
messages.unexpectedTestCons: Unexpected newline between test and consequent of ternary expression.
messages.unexpectedConsAlt: Unexpected newline between consequent and alternate of ternary expression.

multiline-ternary.description: Enforce newlines between operands of ternary expressions

newline-per-chained-call.description: Require a newline after each call in a method chain

messages.unnecessary: Unnecessary '()' invoking a constructor with no arguments.

new-parens.description: Enforce or disallow parentheses when invoking a constructor with no arguments

messages.leading: A leading decimal point can be confused with a dot.
messages.trailing: A trailing decimal point can be confused with a dot.

no-floating-decimal.description: Disallow leading or trailing decimal points in numeric literals

no-mixed-spaces-and-tabs.description: Disallow mixed spaces and tabs for indentation

messages.blankBeginningOfFile: Too many blank lines at the beginning of file. Max of {{max}} allowed.
messages.blankEndOfFile: Too many blank lines at the end of file. Max of {{max}} allowed.

no-trailing-spaces.description: Disallow trailing whitespace at the end of lines

messages.expectNoLinebreak: Expected no linebreak before this statement.
messages.expectLinebreak: Expected a linebreak before this statement.

nonblock-statement-body-position.description: Enforce the location of single-line statements

messages.unexpectedLinebreakBeforeClosingBrace: Unexpected line break before this closing brace.
messages.unexpectedLinebreakAfterOpeningBrace: Unexpected line break after this opening brace.
messages.expectedLinebreakBeforeClosingBrace: Expected a line break before this closing brace.
messages.expectedLinebreakAfterOpeningBrace: Expected a line break after this opening brace.

object-curly-newline.description: Enforce consistent line breaks after opening and before closing braces

messages.unexpectedSpaceBefore: There should be no space before '{{token}}'.
messages.unexpectedSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '{{token}}'.

messages.propertiesOnNewlineAll: Object properties must go on a new line if they aren't all on the same line.
messages.propertiesOnNewline: Object properties must go on a new line.

object-property-newline.description: Enforce placing object properties on separate lines

messages.expectVarOnNewline: Expected variable declaration to be on a new line.

one-var-declaration-per-line.description: Require or disallow newlines around variable declarations

messages.operatorAtBeginning: '{{operator}}' should be placed at the beginning of the line.
messages.operatorAtEnd: '{{operator}}' should be placed at the end of the line.
messages.badLinebreak: Bad line breaking before and after '{{operator}}'.
messages.noLinebreak: There should be no line break before or after '{{operator}}'.

operator-linebreak.description: Enforce consistent linebreak style for operators

messages.alwaysPadBlock: Block must be padded by blank lines.
messages.neverPadBlock: Block must not be padded by blank lines.

padded-blocks.description: Require or disallow padding within blocks

messages.requireQuotesDueToReservedWord: Properties should be quoted as '{{property}}' is a reserved word.
messages.unquotedReservedProperty: Unquoted reserved word '{{property}}' used as key.
messages.unquotedNumericProperty: Unquoted number literal '{{property}}' used as key.
messages.redundantQuoting: Properties shouldn't be quoted as all quotes are redundant.

quote-props.description: Require quotes around object literal property names

rest-spread-spacing.description: Enforce spacing between rest and spread operators and their expressions

semi.description: Require or disallow semicolons instead of ASI

semi-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after semicolons

messages.expectedSemiColon: Expected this semicolon to be at {{pos}}.

space-before-function-paren.description: Enforce consistent spacing before `function` definition opening parenthesis

messages.missingOpeningSpace: There must be a space after this paren.
messages.missingClosingSpace: There must be a space before this paren.
messages.rejectedOpeningSpace: There should be no space after this paren.
messages.rejectedClosingSpace: There should be no space before this paren.

messages.unexpectedAfterWord: Unexpected space after unary word operator '{{word}}'.
messages.wordOperator: Unary word operator '{{word}}' must be followed by whitespace.
messages.operator: Unary operator '{{operator}}' must be followed by whitespace.
messages.beforeUnaryExpressions: Space is required before unary expressions '{{token}}'.

space-unary-ops.description: Enforce consistent spacing before or after unary operators

switch-colon-spacing.description: Enforce spacing around colons of switch statements

template-curly-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing around embedded expressions of template strings

messages.unexpected: Unexpected space between template tag and template literal.
messages.missing: Missing space between template tag and template literal.

template-tag-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing between template tags and their literals

unicode-bom.description: Require or disallow Unicode byte order mark (BOM)

messages.wrapInvocation: Wrap an immediate function invocation in parentheses.
messages.wrapExpression: Wrap only the function expression in parens.
messages.moveInvocation: Move the invocation into the parens that contain the function.

messages.requireParens: Wrap the regexp literal in parens to disambiguate the slash.

yield-star-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing around the `*` in `yield*` expressions

messages.noSpacedFunction: Unexpected space between function name and paren.

no-spaced-func.description: Disallow spacing between function identifiers and their applications (deprecated)

messages.redeclaredAsBuiltin: '{{id}}' is already defined as a built-in global variable.
messages.redeclaredBySyntax: '{{id}}' is already defined by a variable declaration.

messages.object: Expected an error object to be thrown.

messages.preferLiteral: The array literal notation [] is preferable.

messages.noLossOfPrecision: This number literal will lose precision at runtime.

no-loss-of-precision.description: Disallow literal numbers that lose precision

messages.missingSome: Lacked a call of 'super()' in some code paths.
messages.badSuper: Unexpected 'super()' because 'super' is not a constructor.

messages.expected: Expected to return a value in {{name}}.
messages.expectedAlways: Expected {{name}} to always return a value.

no-dupe-keys.description: Disallow duplicate keys in object literals

messages.noNewSymbol: `Symbol` cannot be called as a constructor.

messages.unexpectedRefCall: '{{name}}' is reference to '{{ref}}', which is not a function.

no-obj-calls.description: Disallow calling global object properties as functions

no-undef.description: Disallow the use of undeclared variables unless mentioned in `/*global */` comments

no-unreachable.description: Disallow unreachable code after `return`, `throw`, `continue`, and `break` statements

messages.unexpected: Unexpected negating the left operand of '{{operator}}' operator.
messages.suggestNegatedExpression: Negate '{{operator}}' expression instead of its left operand. This changes the current behavior.
messages.suggestParenthesisedNegation: Wrap negation in '()' to make the intention explicit. This preserves the current behavior.

no-unsafe-negation.description: Disallow negating the left operand of relational operators

messages.unexpectedVar: Unexpected var, use let or const instead.

prefer-const.description: Require `const` declarations for variables that are never reassigned after declared

messages.preferRestParams: Use the rest parameters instead of 'arguments'.

messages.preferSpread: Use the spread operator instead of '.apply()'.

messages.notString: Typeof comparisons should be to string literals.

valid-typeof.description: Enforce comparing `typeof` expressions against valid strings

messages.incorrectDirection: The update clause in this loop moves the variable in the wrong direction.

for-direction.description: Enforce "for" loop update clause moving the counter in the right direction

messages.async: Promise executor functions should not be async.

no-async-promise-executor.description: Disallow using an async function as a Promise executor

messages.unexpected: Unexpected lexical declaration in case block.

no-case-declarations.description: Disallow lexical declarations in case clauses

messages.unexpected: Do not use the '{{operator}}' operator to compare against -0.

messages.missing: Expected a conditional expression and instead saw an assignment.

no-cond-assign.description: Disallow assignment operators in conditional expressions

messages.unexpected: Unexpected control character(s) in regular expression: {{controlChars}}.

no-control-regex.description: Disallow control characters in regular expressions

messages.unexpected: This branch can never execute. Its condition is a duplicate or covered by previous conditions in the if-else-if chain.

no-dupe-else-if.description: Disallow duplicate conditions in if-else-if chains

no-empty-character-class.description: Disallow empty character classes in regular expressions

messages.unexpected: Do not assign to the exception parameter.

messages.globalShouldNotBeModified: Read-only global '{{name}}' should not be modified.

no-global-assign.description: Disallow assignments to native objects or read-only global variables

no-inner-declarations.description: Disallow variable or `function` declarations in nested blocks

no-invalid-regexp.description: Disallow invalid regular expression strings in `RegExp` constructors

messages.surrogatePairWithoutUFlag: Unexpected surrogate pair in character class. Use 'u' flag.
messages.combiningClass: Unexpected combined character in character class.
messages.emojiModifier: Unexpected modified Emoji in character class.
messages.regionalIndicatorSymbol: Unexpected national flag in character class.
messages.zwj: Unexpected joined character sequence in character class.

no-misleading-character-class.description: Disallow characters which are made with multiple code points in character class syntax

messages.refactor: Replace '{{original}}' with '{{replacement}}'. This maintains the current functionality.
messages.escapeBackslash: Replace '{{original}}' with '{{replacement}}' to include the actual backslash character.

no-nonoctal-decimal-escape.description: Disallow `\8` and `\9` escape sequences in string literals

messages.noOctal: Octal literals should not be used.

messages.prototypeBuildIn: Do not access Object.prototype method '{{prop}}' from target object.

no-prototype-builtins.description: Disallow calling some `Object.prototype` methods directly on objects

messages.multipleSpaces: Spaces are hard to count. Use {{{length}}}.

no-regex-spaces.description: Disallow multiple spaces in regular expressions

no-self-assign.description: Disallow assignments where both sides are exactly the same

no-shadow-restricted-names.description: Disallow identifiers from shadowing restricted names

messages.unexpectedSparseArray: Unexpected comma in middle of array.

no-unsafe-finally.description: Disallow control flow statements in `finally` blocks

messages.unsafeOptionalChain: Unsafe usage of optional chaining. If it short-circuits with 'undefined' the evaluation will throw TypeError.
messages.unsafeArithmetic: Unsafe arithmetic operation on optional chaining. It can result in NaN.

no-unsafe-optional-chaining.description: Disallow use of optional chaining in contexts where the `undefined` value is not allowed

messages.nested: Backreference '{{ bref }}' will be ignored. It references group '{{ group }}' from within that group.
messages.forward: Backreference '{{ bref }}' will be ignored. It references group '{{ group }}' which appears later in the pattern.
messages.backward: Backreference '{{ bref }}' will be ignored. It references group '{{ group }}' which appears before in the same lookbehind.
messages.disjunctive: Backreference '{{ bref }}' will be ignored. It references group '{{ group }}' which is in another alternative.
messages.intoNegativeLookaround: Backreference '{{ bref }}' will be ignored. It references group '{{ group }}' which is in a negative lookaround.

no-useless-backreference.description: Disallow useless backreferences in regular expressions

messages.removeEscape: Remove the `\`. This maintains the current functionality.
messages.escapeBackslash: Replace the `\` with `\\` to include the actual backslash character.

messages.missingYield: This generator function does not have 'yield'.

messages.comparisonWithNaN: Use the isNaN function to compare with NaN.
messages.switchNaN: 'switch(NaN)' can never match a case clause. Use Number.isNaN instead of the switch.
messages.caseNaN: 'case NaN' can never match. Use Number.isNaN before the switch.
messages.indexOfNaN: Array prototype method '{{ methodName }}' cannot find NaN.

use-isnan.description: Require calls to `isNaN()` when checking for `NaN`

quotes.description: Enforce the consistent use of either backticks, double, or single quotes

messages.nextLineOpen: Opening curly brace does not appear on the same line as controlling statement.
messages.sameLineOpen: Opening curly brace appears on the same line as controlling statement.
messages.blockSameLine: Statement inside of curly braces should be on next line.
messages.nextLineClose: Closing curly brace does not appear on the same line as the subsequent block.
messages.singleLineClose: Closing curly brace should be on the same line as opening curly brace or on the line after the previous block.
messages.sameLineClose: Closing curly brace appears on the same line as the subsequent block.

brace-style.description: Enforce consistent brace style for blocks

comma-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after commas

messages.unexpectedWhitespace: Unexpected whitespace between function name and paren.
messages.unexpectedNewline: Unexpected newline between function name and paren.
messages.missing: Missing space between function name and paren.

func-call-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing between function identifiers and their invocations

keyword-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after keywords

member-delimiter-style.description: Require a specific member delimiter style for interfaces and type literals

messages.unexpectedSpaceBefore: There should be no space before '{{token}}'.
messages.unexpectedSpaceAfter: There should be no space after '{{token}}'.

semi.description: Require or disallow semicolons instead of ASI

space-before-function-paren.description: Enforce consistent spacing before function parenthesis

messages.unexpectedSpaceBetween: Unexpected space between the '{{previousToken}}' and the '{{type}}'.

type-annotation-spacing.description: Require consistent spacing around type annotations

messages.tsDirectiveComment: Do not use "@ts-{{directive}}" because it alters compilation errors.
messages.tsDirectiveCommentRequiresDescription: Include a description after the "@ts-{{directive}}" directive to explain why the @ts-{{directive}} is necessary. The description must be {{minimumDescriptionLength}} characters or longer.
messages.tsDirectiveCommentDescriptionNotMatchPat: The description for the "@ts-{{directive}}" directive must match the {{format}} format.

ban-ts-comment.description: Disallow `@ts-<directive>` comments or require descriptions after directives

messages.unsafeCall: Unsafe call of an `any` typed value.
messages.unsafeCallThis:
Unsafe call of an `any` typed value. `this` is typed as `any`.
You can try to fix this by turning on the `noImplicitThis` compiler option, or adding a `this` parameter to the function.
messages.unsafeNew: Unsafe construction of an any type value.

no-unsafe-call.description: Disallow calling a value with type `any`

messages.noInferrableType: Type {{type}} trivially inferred from a {{type}} literal, remove type annotation.

no-inferrable-types.description: Disallow explicit type declarations for variables or parameters initialized to a number, string, or boolean

messages.moduleSyntaxIsPreferred: ES2015 module syntax is preferred over namespaces.

allowDeclarations.description: Whether to allow `declare` with custom TypeScript namespaces.

allowDefinitionFiles.description: Whether to allow `declare` with custom TypeScript namespaces inside definition files.

messages.conditionErrorOther: Unexpected value in conditional. A boolean expression is required.
messages.conditionErrorAny: Unexpected any value in conditional. An explicit comparison or type cast is required.
messages.conditionErrorNullish: Unexpected nullish value in conditional. The condition is always false.
messages.conditionErrorNullableBoolean: Unexpected nullable boolean value in conditional. Please handle the nullish case explicitly.
messages.conditionErrorString: Unexpected string value in conditional. An explicit empty string check is required.
messages.conditionErrorNullableString: Unexpected nullable string value in conditional. Please handle the nullish/empty cases explicitly.
messages.conditionErrorNumber: Unexpected number value in conditional. An explicit zero/NaN check is required.
messages.conditionErrorNullableNumber: Unexpected nullable number value in conditional. Please handle the nullish/zero/NaN cases explicitly.
messages.conditionErrorObject: Unexpected object value in conditional. The condition is always true.
messages.conditionErrorNullableObject: Unexpected nullable object value in conditional. An explicit null check is required.
messages.noStrictNullCheck: This rule requires the `strictNullChecks` compiler option to be turned on to function correctly.
messages.conditionFixDefaultFalse: Explicitly treat nullish value the same as false (`value ?? false`)
messages.conditionFixDefaultEmptyString: Explicitly treat nullish value the same as an empty string (`value ?? ""`)
messages.conditionFixDefaultZero: Explicitly treat nullish value the same as 0 (`value ?? 0`)
messages.conditionFixCompareNullish: Change condition to check for null/undefined (`value != null`)
messages.conditionFixCastBoolean: Explicitly cast value to a boolean (`Boolean(value)`)
messages.conditionFixCompareTrue: Change condition to check if true (`value === true`)
messages.conditionFixCompareFalse: Change condition to check if false (`value === false`)
messages.conditionFixCompareStringLength: Change condition to check string's length (`value.length !== 0`)
messages.conditionFixCompareEmptyString: Change condition to check for empty string (`value !== ""`)
messages.conditionFixCompareNaN: Change condition to check for NaN (`!Number.isNaN(value)`)

strict-boolean-expressions.description: Disallow certain types in boolean expressions

messages.notNumbers: Operands of '+' operation must either be both strings or both numbers.
messages.notStrings: Operands of '+' operation must either be both strings or both numbers. Consider using a template literal.
messages.notBigInts: Operands of '+' operation must be both bigints.
messages.notValidAnys: Operands of '+' operation with any is possible only with string, number, bigint or any
messages.notValidTypes: Operands of '+' operation must either be one of string, number, bigint or any (if allowed by option)

checkCompoundAssignments.description: Whether to check compound assignments such as `+=`.

restrict-plus-operands.description: Require both operands of addition to be the same type and be `bigint`, `number`, or `string`

messages.preferTypeParameter: Unnecessary cast: Array#reduce accepts a type parameter for the default value.

prefer-reduce-type-parameter.description: Enforce using type parameter when calling `Array#reduce` instead of casting

messages.redeclaredAsBuiltin: '{{id}}' is already defined as a built-in global variable.
messages.redeclaredBySyntax: '{{id}}' is already defined by a variable declaration.

messages.object: Expected an error object to be thrown.

allowConciseArrowFunctionExpressionsStar.description: Whether to allow arrow functions that start with the `void` keyword.

allowExpressions.description: Whether to ignore function expressions (functions which are not part of a declaration).

allowHigherOrderFunctions.description: Whether to ignore functions immediately returning another function expression.

allowTypedFunctionExpressions.description: Whether to ignore type annotations on the variable of function expressions.

allowDirectConstAssertionInArrowFunction.description: Whether to ignore arrow functions immediately returning a `as const` value.

allowedNames.description: An array of function/method names that will not have their arguments or return values checked.

explicit-function-return-type.description: Require explicit return types on functions and class methods

messages.confusingEqual: Confusing combinations of non-null assertion and equal test like "a! == b", which looks very similar to not equal "a !== b".
messages.confusingAssign: Confusing combinations of non-null assertion and equal test like "a! = b", which looks very similar to not equal "a != b".
messages.notNeedInEqualTest: Unnecessary non-null assertion (!) in equal test.
messages.notNeedInAssign: Unnecessary non-null assertion (!) in assignment left hand.
messages.wrapUpLeft: Wrap up left hand to avoid putting non-null assertion "!" and "=" together.

no-confusing-non-null-assertion.description: Disallow non-null assertion in locations that may be confusing

messages.dynamicDelete: Do not delete dynamically computed property keys.

no-dynamic-delete.description: Disallow using the `delete` operator on computed key expressions

messages.invalidVoidForGeneric: {{ generic }} may not have void as a type argument.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturnOrGeneric: void is only valid as a return type or generic type argument.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturn: void is only valid as a return type.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturnOrThisParam: void is only valid as return type or type of `this` parameter.
messages.invalidVoidNotReturnOrThisParamOrGeneric: void is only valid as a return type or generic type argument or the type of a `this` parameter.
messages.invalidVoidUnionConstituent: void is not valid as a constituent in a union type

no-invalid-void-type.description: Disallow `void` type outside of generic or return types

messages.anyTypedArg: Argument '{{name}}' should be typed with a non-any type.
messages.anyTypedArgUnnamed: {{type}} argument should be typed with a non-any type.

allowArgumentsExplicitlyTypedAsAny.description: Whether to ignore arguments that are explicitly typed as `any`.

allowDirectConstAssertionInArrowFunction.description:
Whether to ignore return type annotations on body-less arrow functions that return an `as const` type assertion.
You must still type the parameters of the function.

allowedNames.description: An array of function/method names that will not have their arguments or return values checked.

allowHigherOrderFunctions.description:
Whether to ignore return type annotations on functions immediately returning another function expression.
You must still type the parameters of the function.

allowTypedFunctionExpressions.description: Whether to ignore type annotations on the variable of a function expresion.

explicit-module-boundary-types.description: Require explicit return and argument types on exported functions' and classes' public class methods

no-base-to-string.description: Require `.toString()` to only be called on objects which provide useful information when stringified

messages.forInViolation: For-in loops over arrays are forbidden. Use for-of or array.forEach instead.

no-for-in-array.description: Disallow iterating over an array with a for-in loop

messages.unnecessaryQualifier: Qualifier is unnecessary since '{{ name }}' is in scope.

messages.voidReturnArgument: Promise returned in function argument where a void return was expected.
messages.voidReturnVariable: Promise-returning function provided to variable where a void return was expected.
messages.voidReturnProperty: Promise-returning function provided to property where a void return was expected.
messages.voidReturnReturnValue: Promise-returning function provided to return value where a void return was expected.
messages.voidReturnAttribute: Promise-returning function provided to attribute where a void return was expected.
messages.conditional: Expected non-Promise value in a boolean conditional.
messages.spread: Expected a non-Promise value to be spreaded in an object.

no-misused-promises.description: Disallow Promises in places not designed to handle them

allowDestructuring.description: Whether to ignore destructurings, such as `const { props, state } = this`.

allowedNames.description: Names to ignore, such as ["self"] for `const self = this;`.

messages.thisAssignment: Unexpected aliasing of 'this' to local variable.
messages.thisDestructure: Unexpected aliasing of members of 'this' to local variables.

messages.unsafeArgument: Unsafe argument of type `{{sender}}` assigned to a parameter of type `{{receiver}}`.
messages.unsafeTupleSpread: Unsafe spread of a tuple type. The argument is of type `{{sender}}` and is assigned to a parameter of type `{{receiver}}`.
messages.unsafeArraySpread: Unsafe spread of an `any` array type.

no-unsafe-argument.description: Disallow calling a function with a value with type `any`

messages.unsafeMerging: Unsafe declaration merging between classes and interfaces.

messages.uselessExport: Empty export does nothing and can be removed.

no-useless-empty-export.description: Disallow empty exports that don't change anything in a module file

messages.noVarReqs: Require statement not part of import statement.

no-var-requires.description: Disallow `require` statements except in import statements

messages.preferNonNullAssertion: Use a ! assertion to more succinctly remove null and undefined from the type.

non-nullable-type-assertion-style.description: Enforce non-null assertions over explicit type casts

messages.functionTypeOverCallableType: {{ literalOrInterface }} only has a call signature, you should use a function type instead.
messages.unexpectedThisOnFunctionOnlyInterface: `this` refers to the function type '{{ interfaceName }}', did you intend to use a generic `this` parameter like `<Self>(this: Self, ...) => Self` instead?

prefer-function-type.description: Enforce using function types instead of interfaces with call signatures

messages.tripleSlashReference: Do not use a triple slash reference for {{module}}, use `import` style instead.

triple-slash-reference.description: Disallow certain triple slash directives in favor of ES6-style import declarations

messages.preferExpectErrorComment: Use "@ts-expect-error" to ensure an error is actually being suppressed.

ignoreDifferentlyNamedParameters.description: Whether two parameters with different names at the same index should be considered different even if their types are the same.

unified-signatures.description: Disallow two overloads that could be unified into one with a union or an optional/rest parameter

messages.suggestFix: Sort constituents of type (removes all comments).

sort-type-constituents.description: Enforce constituents of a type union/intersection to be sorted alphabetically

messages.preferOptionalChain: Prefer using an optional chain expression instead, as it's more concise and easier to read.

prefer-optional-chain.description: Enforce using concise optional chain expressions instead of chained logical ands, negated logical ors, or empty objects

messages.direct: This expression unnecessarily compares a boolean value to a boolean instead of using it directly.
messages.negated: This expression unnecessarily compares a boolean value to a boolean instead of negating it.
messages.comparingNullableToTrueDirect: This expression unnecessarily compares a nullable boolean value to true instead of using it directly.
messages.comparingNullableToTrueNegated: This expression unnecessarily compares a nullable boolean value to true instead of negating it.
messages.comparingNullableToFalse: This expression unnecessarily compares a nullable boolean value to false instead of using the ?? operator to provide a default.

allowComparingNullableBooleansToTrue.description: Whether to allow comparisons between nullable boolean variables and `true`.

allowComparingNullableBooleansToFalse.description: Whether to allow comparisons between nullable boolean variables and `false`.

no-unnecessary-boolean-literal-compare.description: Disallow unnecessary equality comparisons against boolean literals

prefer-string-starts-ends-with.description: Enforce using `String#startsWith` and `String#endsWith` over other equivalent methods of checking substrings

messages.switchIsNotExhaustive: Switch is not exhaustive. Cases not matched: {{missingBranches}}

switch-exhaustiveness-check.description: Require switch-case statements to be exhaustive with union type

messages.preferForOf: Expected a `for-of` loop instead of a `for` loop with this simple iteration.

prefer-for-of.description: Enforce the use of `for-of` loop over the standard `for` loop where possible

ignoreStringArrays.description: Whether to ignore arrays in which all elements are strings.

require-array-sort-compare.description: Require `Array#sort` calls to always provide a `compareFunction`

messages.invalidVoidExpr: Placing a void expression inside another expression is forbidden. Move it to its own statement instead.
messages.invalidVoidExprWrapVoid: Void expressions used inside another expression must be moved to its own statement or marked explicitly with the `void` operator.
messages.invalidVoidExprArrow: Returning a void expression from an arrow function shorthand is forbidden. Please add braces to the arrow function.
messages.invalidVoidExprArrowWrapVoid: Void expressions returned from an arrow function shorthand must be marked explicitly with the `void` operator.
messages.invalidVoidExprReturn: Returning a void expression from a function is forbidden. Please move it before the `return` statement.
messages.invalidVoidExprReturnLast: Returning a void expression from a function is forbidden. Please remove the `return` statement.
messages.invalidVoidExprReturnWrapVoid: Void expressions returned from a function must be marked explicitly with the `void` operator.

no-confusing-void-expression.description: Require expressions of type void to appear in statement position

messages.unexpectedAny: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.
messages.suggestUnknown: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
messages.suggestNever: Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.

fixToUnknown.description: Whether to enable auto-fixing in which the `any` type is converted to the `unknown` type.

ignoreRestArgs.description: Whether to ignore rest parameter arrays.

messages.expectedTypedefNamed: Expected {{name}} to have a type annotation.

typedef.description: Require type annotations in certain places

oneOf.description: Require an accessor except when public.
Never check whether there is an accessor.

explicit-member-accessibility.description: Require explicit accessibility modifiers on class properties and methods

messages.incorrectOrder: Member {{member}} should be declared before member {{beforeMember}}.
messages.incorrectGroupOrder: Member {{name}} should be declared before all {{rank}} definitions.
messages.incorrectRequiredMembersOrder: Member {{member}} should be declared after all {{optionalOrRequired}} members.

member-ordering.description: Require a consistent member declaration order

messages.unexpectedUnderscore: {{type}} name `{{name}}` must not have a {{position}} underscore.
messages.missingAffix: {{type}} name `{{name}}` must have one of the following {{position}}es: {{affixes}}
messages.doesNotMatchFormat: {{type}} name `{{name}}` must match one of the following formats: {{formats}}
messages.doesNotMatchFormatTrimmed: {{type}} name `{{name}}` trimmed as `{{processedName}}` must match one of the following formats: {{formats}}

naming-convention.description: Enforce naming conventions for everything across a codebase

adjacent-overload-signatures.description: Require that function overload signatures be consecutive

messages.useLiteral: The array literal notation [] is preferable.

messages.noEmpty: An empty interface is equivalent to `{}`.
messages.noEmptyWithSuper: An interface declaring no members is equivalent to its supertype.

no-empty-interface.description: Disallow the declaration of empty interfaces

messages.noLossOfPrecision: This number literal will lose precision at runtime.

no-loss-of-precision.description: Disallow literal numbers that lose precision

messages.errorMessageInterface: Interfaces cannot be constructed, only classes.

messages.noNonNullOptionalChain: Optional chain expressions can return undefined by design - using a non-null assertion is unsafe and wrong.
messages.suggestRemovingNonNull: You should remove the non-null assertion.

no-non-null-asserted-optional-chain.description: Disallow non-null assertions after an optional chain expression

messages.suggestOptionalChain: Consider using the optional chain operator `?.` instead. This operator includes runtime checks, so it is safer than the compile-only non-null assertion operator.

no-non-null-assertion.description: Disallow non-null assertions using the `!` postfix operator

messages.unnecessaryConstraint: Constraining the generic type `{{name}}` to `{{constraint}}` does nothing and is unnecessary.

no-unnecessary-type-constraint.description: Disallow unnecessary constraints on generic types

messages.preferConstAssertion: Expected a `const` instead of a literal type assertion.
messages.variableConstAssertion: Expected a `const` assertion instead of a literal type annotation.
messages.variableSuggest: You should use `as const` instead of type annotation.

prefer-as-const.description: Enforce the use of `as const` over literal type

messages.useNamespace: Use 'namespace' instead of 'module' to declare custom TypeScript modules.

prefer-namespace-keyword.description: Require using `namespace` keyword over `module` keyword to declare custom TypeScript modules

messages.noOutputRename: Output bindings should not be aliased (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-13)
messages.suggestReplaceOriginalNameWithAliasName: Remove alias name and use it as the original name

no-output-rename.description: Ensures that output bindings are not aliased

allowedNames.description: A list with allowed input names

messages.noInputRename: Input bindings should not be aliased (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-13)
messages.suggestReplaceOriginalNameWithAliasName: Remove alias name and use it as the original name

no-input-rename.description: Ensures that input bindings are not aliased

contextual-decorator.description: Ensures that classes use contextual decorators in its body

messages.contextualLifecycle: Angular will not invoke the `{{methodName}}` lifecycle method within `@{{classDecoratorName}}()` classes

contextual-lifecycle.description: Ensures that lifecycle methods are used in a correct context

messages.noConflictingLifecycleInterface: Implementing DoCheck and OnChanges in a class is not recommended
messages.noConflictingLifecycleMethod: Declaring ngDoCheck and ngOnChanges method in a class is not recommended

no-conflicting-lifecycle.description: Ensures that directives not implement conflicting lifecycle interfaces.

messages.noLifecycleCall: Avoid explicit calls to lifecycle methods

no-lifecycle-call.description: Disallows explicit calls to lifecycle methods

messages.noOutputOnPrefix: Output bindings, including aliases, should not be named "on", nor prefixed with it (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-16)

no-output-on-prefix.description: Ensures that output bindings, including aliases, are not named "on", nor prefixed with it. See more at https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-16

messages.preferOnPushComponentChangeDetection: The component's `changeDetection` value should be set to `ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush`

messages.relativeUrlPrefix: The ./ and ../ prefix is standard syntax for relative URLs. (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-04)

relative-url-prefix.description: The ./ and ../ prefix is standard syntax for relative URLs; don't depend on Angular's current ability to do without that prefix. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-04

locale.description: A string with a BCP 47 language tag.

messages.sortNgmoduleMetadataArrays: `NgModule` metadata arrays should be sorted in ASC alphabetical order

sort-ngmodule-metadata-arrays.description: Ensures ASC alphabetical order for `NgModule` metadata arrays for easy visual scanning

messages.useComponentSelector: The selector of the component is mandatory

messages.useLifecycleInterface: Lifecycle interface '{{interfaceName}}' should be implemented for method '{{methodName}}'. (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-09-01)

use-lifecycle-interface.description: Ensures that classes implement lifecycle interfaces corresponding to the declared lifecycle methods. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-09-01

messages.prefixFailure: The selector should start with one of these prefixes: {{prefix}} (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-08)
messages.typeFailure: The selector should be used as an {{type}} (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-06)

directive-selector.description: Directive selectors should follow given naming rules. See more at https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-06 and https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-08.

messages.prefixFailure: The selector should start with one of these prefixes: {{prefix}} (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-07)
messages.styleAndPrefixFailure: The selector should be {{style}} and start with one of these prefixes: {{prefix}} (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-02 and https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-07)
messages.typeFailure: The selector should be used as an {{type}} (https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-03)
messages.shadowDomEncapsulatedStyleFailure: The selector of a ShadowDom-encapsulated component should be `kebab-case` (https://github.com/angular-eslint/angular-eslint/issues/534)

component-selector.description:
Component selectors should follow given naming rules. See more at https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-02-07, https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-02
      and https://angular.io/guide/styleguide#style-05-03.

messages.componentClassSuffix: Component class names should end with one of these suffixes: {{suffixes}} (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-02-03)

component-class-suffix.description: Classes decorated with @Component must have suffix "Component" (or custom) in their name. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-02-03

messages.directiveClassSuffix: Directive class names should end with one of these suffixes: {{suffixes}} (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-02-03)

directive-class-suffix.description: Classes decorated with @Directive must have suffix "Directive" (or custom) in their name. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-02-03

messages.noEmptyLifecycleMethod: Lifecycle methods should not be empty

messages.noHostMetadataProperty: Use @HostBinding or @HostListener rather than the `host` metadata property (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-06-03)

no-host-metadata-property.description: Disallows usage of the `host` metadata property. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-06-03

messages.noInputsMetadataProperty: Use `@Input` rather than the `inputs` metadata property (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-12)

no-inputs-metadata-property.description: Disallows usage of the `inputs` metadata property. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-12

messages.noOutputNative: Output bindings, including aliases, should not be named as standard DOM events

no-output-native.description: Ensures that output bindings, including aliases, are not named as standard DOM events

messages.noOutputsMetadataProperty: Use `@Output` rather than the `outputs` metadata property (https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-12)

no-outputs-metadata-property.description: Disallows usage of the `outputs` metadata property. See more at https://angular.io/styleguide#style-05-12

messages.expectedAbove: Expected @{{ name }} to be on the line above.

decorator-position.description: enforce consistent decorator position on properties and methods

allowUnsafeDynamicCyclicDependency.description: Allow cyclic dependency if there is at least one dynamic import in the chain

no-cycle.description: Forbid a module from importing a module with a dependency path back to itself.

no-self-import.description: Forbid a module from importing itself.

no-unresolved.description: Ensure imports point to a file/module that can be resolved.

no-extraneous-dependencies.description: Forbid the use of extraneous packages.

no-mutable-exports.description: Forbid the use of mutable exports with `var` or `let`.

no-named-as-default-member.description: Forbid use of exported name as property of default export.

src.description: files/paths to be analyzed (only for unused exports)

ignoreExports.description: files/paths for which unused exports will not be reported (e.g module entry points)

no-unused-modules.description: Forbid modules without exports, or exports without matching import in another module.

no-absolute-path.description: Forbid import of modules using absolute paths.

no-useless-path-segments.description: Forbid unnecessary path segments in import and require statements.

first.description: Ensure all imports appear before other statements.

no-duplicates.description: Forbid repeated import of the same module in multiple places.

no-webpack-loader-syntax.description: Forbid webpack loader syntax in imports.

no-relative-packages.description: Forbid importing packages through relative paths.

newline-after-import.description: Enforce a newline after import statements.

order.description: Enforce a convention in module import order.

named.description: Ensure named imports correspond to a named export in the remote file.

allowComputed.description: If `false`, will report computed (and thus, un-lintable) references to namespace members.

namespace.description: Ensure imported namespaces contain dereferenced properties as they are dereferenced.

default.description: Ensure a default export is present, given a default import.

export.description: Forbid any invalid exports, i.e. re-export of the same name.

no-named-as-default.description: Forbid use of exported name as identifier of default export.

no-topromise.description: Forbids the use of the `toPromise` method.

throw-error.description: Enforces the passing of `Error` values to error notifications.

messages.shouldBeFinnish: Finnish notation should be used here.
messages.shouldNotBeFinnish: Finnish notation should not be used here.

finnish.description: Enforces the use of Finnish notation.

messages.forbidden: Passing async functions to subscribe is forbidden.
Observable.create is forbidden; use new Observable.

no-ignored-notifier.description: Forbids observables not composed from the `repeatWhen` or `retryWhen` notifier.

messages.forbidden: Ignoring the buffer size is forbidden.

no-ignored-replay-buffer.description: Forbids using `ReplaySubject`, `publishReplay` or `shareReplay` without specifying the buffer size.

messages.forbidden: Ignoring the value within takeWhile is forbidden.

messages.suggestExplicitUnknown: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly and safely assert the type is correct.

no-implicit-any-catch.description: Forbids implicit `any` error parameters in `catchError` operators.

messages.forbidden: RxJS imports from index modules are forbidden.

no-index.description: Forbids the importation from index modules.

messages.forbidden: RxJS imports from internal are forbidden.

no-nested-subscribe.description: Forbids the calling of `subscribe` within a `subscribe` callback.

no-redundant-notify.description: Forbids redundant notifications from completed or errored observables.

messages.forbiddenWithoutConfig: shareReplay is forbidden unless a config argument is passed.

messages.forbidden: Calling unsubscribe on a subject is forbidden.

no-subject-unsubscribe.description: Forbids calling the `unsubscribe` method of a subject instance.

no-unbound-methods.description: Forbids the passing of unbound methods.

messages.forbidden: Unsafe optional next calls are forbidden.
Applying operators after takeUntil is forbidden.

schema.description:
An optional object with optional `alias` and `allow` properties.
The `alias` property is an array containing the names of operators that aliases for `takeUntil`.
The `allow` property is an array containing the names of the operators that are allowed to follow `takeUntil`.

no-unsafe-takeuntil.description: Forbids the application of operators after `takeUntil`.
